required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety Study of Deferasirox in Patients With Non-transfusion Dependent Thalassemia
clinical_study.official_title: An Open Label, Multi-center, Efficacy and Safety Study of Deferasirox in Iron Overloaded Patients With Non-transfusion Dependent Thalassemia

brief_summary.textblock: Assessed the efficacy of deferasirox in patients with non-transfusion dependent thalassemia based on change in liver iron concentration from baseline after 52 weeks of treatment. Provided further assessment of the long-term efficacy and safety of deferasirox in NTDT patients with iron overload (LIC ≥ 5 mg Fe/g liver dw and SF ≥ 300 ng/mL) for up to 260 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Liver Iron Content (LIC) at 52 Weeks From Baseline
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change in liver iron concentration measured by MRI from baseline after 52 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Baseline LIC>15 Achieving LIC<5 mg Fe/g dw
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with baseline LIC>15 mg Fe/g dw achieving an LIC <5 mg Fe/g dw during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Achieving LIC <5 mg Fe/g dw
secondary_outcome.description: Time to achieving LIC <5 mg Fe/g dw for participants with baseline LIC>15 mg Fe/g dw during the study

secondary_outcome.measure: Time From Target LIC of 3 mg Fe/g dw to the First LIC ≥5 mg Fe/g dw in the Follow up Period
secondary_outcome.description: Time from the target LIC <3 mg Fe/g dw to the first LIC ≥5 mg Fe/g dw in the follow-up period

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Health-related Outcomes Using Medical Outcomes Study Form 36 (SF-36v2)
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a self-administered questionnaire for adults (from 18 years of age) and contains 36 items which measure: Physical functioning, Role limitation due to physical health problems, Bodily pain, General health perceptions, Vitality, Social functioning, Role limitations due to emotional problems and General mental health . The higher values indicate a better evaluation of health. Range: 0 to 100 [0 (worst possible health state measured by the questionnaire) to 100 (best possible health state)].

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Health-related Outcomes Using the Pediatric Quality of Life Questionnaire (PedsQL™)
secondary_outcome.description: The PedsQL™ is a modular approach to measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in children and adolescents. The 23-item PedsQL™ Generic Core Scales encompass the essential core domains for pediatric HRQOL measurement: 1) Physical Functioning (8 items), 2) Emotional Functioning (5 items), 3) Social Functioning (5 items), and 4) School Functioning (5 items). The Generic Core Scales are designed to enable comparisons across patient and healthy populations. The higher values indicate a better evaluation of health. Range: 0 to 100 [0 (worst possible health state measured by the questionnaire) to 100 (best possible health state)].

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in LIC From Baseline Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in serum ferritin from baseline over time up to 260 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Ferritin (SF) vs LIC at Baseline and EOS (Week 260 + 30 Days Follow-up)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, End of Study (EOS): Week 260 + 30 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between serum ferritin and LIC is assessed using scatter plots with pearson correlation coefficient and simple linear model.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation Analysis for Absolute Change in LIC and Serum Ferritin at Week 24 and EOS (Week 260 + 30 Days Follow-up)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 24, End of Study (EOS): Week 260 + 30 days follow up
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation for absolute change between LIC and serum ferritin was assessed using scatter plots with pearson correlation coefficient and simple linear model.

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in LIC From Baseline After 52 Weeks of Treatment by Underlying Non-transfusion Dependent Thalassemia (NTDT) Syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in liver iron concentration measured by MRI from baseline after 52 weeks of treatment by underlying NTDT syndrome. The 4 underlying disease types: Beta-thalassemia intermedia (N =69), HbE beta-thalassemia (N = 24), Alpha-thalassemia intermedia (HbH disease) (N = 40), Other, specify (N = 1)

secondary_outcome.measure: Absolute Change in Serum Ferritin From Baseline After 52 Weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Absolute change in serum ferritin from baseline after 52 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose (0 hour), and at 2, and 4 hours at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, AUCtau was determined using non-compartmental method(s) for deferasirox and its iron complex. AUC=area under the concentration-time curve during a dosing interval at steady state (amount × time × volume).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose (0 hour), and at 2, and 4 hours at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, Cmax, was determined using non-compartmental method(s) for deferasirox and its iron complex. Cmax (maximum/peak plasma drug concentration after drug administration)=amount × volume

secondary_outcome.time_frame: pre-dose (0 hour), and at 2, and 4 hours at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, Tmax, may be determined using non-compartmental method(s) for deferasirox and its iron complex. Tmax=time to reach maximum/peak concentration following drug administration.

Blood samples for PK evaluation were collected for a sub-group of patients. The patient had to have been on treatment without dose adjustment or treatment interruption (for any reason) for at least 4 consecutive days prior to scheduled PK sampling visit. If there was a dosage change or interruption within 4 days of the visit, no PK blood samples was collected, and an appropriate comment had to be made on the PK CRF page.

arm_group.description: All patients were treated with 10mg/kg/day deferasirox with dose adjustments after 4 weeks of treatment according to baseline Liver Iron Concentration (LIC).

intervention.description: Deferasirox dispersible tablets at strengths of 125 mg, 250 mg, and 500 mg were administered by oral daily dosing.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Non-transfusion dependent congenital or chronic anemia inclusive of beta-thalassemia intermedia, HbE beta-thalassemia or alpha-thalassemia intermedia (HbH disease)/ Liver iron concentration >/= 5 mg Fe/g dw Serum Ferritin >/= 300 ng/mL
Exclusion Criteria:
HbS-beta Thalassemia, anticipated regular transfusion program during the study, blood transfusion 6 months prior to study start, significant proteinuria, creatinine clearance </= 40 ml/min, serum creatinine > ULN, ALT >5 x ULN, active hepatitis B or C, cirrhosis
Pediatrics Only:
A patient's weight of at least 20 kg is required to allow dosing of 5 mg/kg with one tablet of 125 mg

patient_data.ipd_description: Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent expert panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations. This trial data is currently available according to the process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: At least 117 patients were planned to be enrolled; 134 patients were enrolled.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: At least 117 patients were planned to be enrolled; 134 patients were enrolled.

outcome.title: Absolute Change in Health-related Outcomes Using the Pediatric Quality of Life Questionnaire (PedsQL™)
outcome.description: The PedsQL™ is a modular approach to measuring health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in children and adolescents. The 23-item PedsQL™ Generic Core Scales encompass the essential core domains for pediatric HRQOL measurement: 1) Physical Functioning (8 items), 2) Emotional Functioning (5 items), 3) Social Functioning (5 items), and 4) School Functioning (5 items). The Generic Core Scales are designed to enable comparisons across patient and healthy populations. The higher values indicate a better evaluation of health. Range: 0 to 100 [0 (worst possible health state measured by the questionnaire) to 100 (best possible health state)].
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of all patients who were assigned at least one dose of study drug.

outcome.title: PK Parameters: AUCtau
outcome.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, AUCtau was determined using non-compartmental method(s) for deferasirox and its iron complex. AUC=area under the concentration-time curve during a dosing interval at steady state (amount × time × volume).
outcome.time_frame: pre-dose (0 hour), and at 2, and 4 hours at Week 4
outcome.population: The PK analysis set consisted of all patients from FAS who had evaluable PK data.

group.title: Deferasirox
group.description: All patients were treated with 10mg/kg/day deferasirox with dose adjustments after 4 weeks of treatment according to baseline Liver Iron Concentration (LIC).

measure.title: PK Parameters: AUCtau
measure.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, AUCtau was determined using non-compartmental method(s) for deferasirox and its iron complex. AUC=area under the concentration-time curve during a dosing interval at steady state (amount × time × volume).
measure.population: The PK analysis set consisted of all patients from FAS who had evaluable PK data.

outcome.description: The pharmacokinetic parameter, Cmax, was determined using non-compartmental method(s) for deferasirox and its iron complex. Cmax (maximum/peak plasma drug concentration after drug administration)=amount × volume

outcome.population: The PK analysis set consisted of all patients from FAS who had evaluable PK data.

outcome.title: Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK) Deferasirox Concentrations
outcome.description: Blood samples for PK evaluation were collected for a sub-group of patients. The patient had to have been on treatment without dose adjustment or treatment interruption (for any reason) for at least 4 consecutive days prior to scheduled PK sampling visit. If there was a dosage change or interruption within 4 days of the visit, no PK blood samples was collected, and an appropriate comment had to be made on the PK CRF page.
outcome.population: The PK analysis set consisted of all patients from FAS who had evaluable PK data.

group.title: Deferasirox
group.description: All patients were treated with 10mg/kg/day deferasirox with dose adjustments after 4 weeks of treatment according to baseline Liver Iron Concentration (LIC).

measure.title: Plasma Pharmacokinetics (PK) Deferasirox Concentrations
measure.description: Blood samples for PK evaluation were collected for a sub-group of patients. The patient had to have been on treatment without dose adjustment or treatment interruption (for any reason) for at least 4 consecutive days prior to scheduled PK sampling visit. If there was a dosage change or interruption within 4 days of the visit, no PK blood samples was collected, and an appropriate comment had to be made on the PK CRF page.
measure.population: The PK analysis set consisted of all patients from FAS who had evaluable PK data.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events and serious adverse events were collected for the maximum actual duration of treatment exposure and follow up for a participant per the protocol for approximately 63.2 months.
reported_events.desc: All cause mortality (deaths) was collected for as long as participants could be contacted from First Patient First Visit (FPFV) until Last Patient Last Visit (LPLV) up to a maximum of 7 years.

group.title: Chinese
group.description: This group was comprised of Chinese participants only

group.title: Non-Chinese
group.description: This group was comprised of non- Chinese participants only

group.title: All Patients
group.description: This group was comprised of all patients: Chinese and non-Chinese participants

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of pooled data (i.e.,data from all sites) in clinical trial or disclosure of trial results in their entirety.
